meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of a monad
meanings.sent1: The monadical concept focuses on the idea of a single, indivisible unit.
meanings.sent2: Her monadical approach to problem-solving involves breaking down complex issues into simple components.
meanings.sent3: In the monadical world of ants, each ant plays a crucial role in the colony's success.
meanings.sent4: The artist's monadical brushstroke captured the essence of solitude in the painting.
meanings.sent5: The monadical beauty of a single snowflake is a marvel of nature.

meanings.definition: Consisting of a single unit or element
meanings.sent1: The monadical crystal structure of diamonds gives them their unparalleled strength.
meanings.sent2: The monadical design of the minimalist house impressed the architect.
meanings.sent3: His monadical wardrobe consisted of only black and white clothing.
meanings.sent4: The monadical melody of the piano echoed through the empty hall.
meanings.sent5: The monadical flavor of the dish came from the chef's secret ingredient.
